patient_information: Age: 28 years Sex: male Country of origin: Ghana Occupation: self-employed
chief_complaint: Painful ulcer on the left ankle for approximately four months.
history_of_present_illness: The patient has a history of a similar ulcer on the right ankle several years ago that took about a year to heal. He also reports bone pain in his right thigh and both knees.
vitals: Temperature: 36.6°C Pulse: 88 bpm Blood pressure: 110/70 mmHg
physical_exam: Ankle ulcer: Present on the left ankle, next to the medial malleolus with hyperpigmented skin surrounding it. Knee joints: Tenderness in both knee joints and in his right thigh Other findings: Rest of physical examination is normal
labs_and_diagnostics: Blood count: WBC: 17.6 × 10^9/L, Hb: 6.9 g/dL, Platelets: Adequate Sickle cell test: Sickling test positive and haemoglobin electrophoresis showed a homozygous HbSS-type. Wound swab: Grew Pseudomonas species sensitive to levofloxacin.
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: Systemic antibiotic treatment with levofloxacin, alternate daily wound dressing using normal saline irrigation and povidone-iodine. Pain management: Pain relief achieved with paracetamol and tramadol Follow up: Ulcer still not healed after 3 years, grafting under consideration.
